casebody.data:
Radcliff and Davis v. the Marine Insurance Company.

THESE points were ruled : 1st. A judge may grant and annul his own order to stay proceedings on a case made as well in term as in vacation, and this, though a rule for judgment be entered, the decision in Shepherd ads. Case, ante, p. 94, applying to judgments perfected. 2d. If a judge has granted an order to stay proceedings on a case made, on account pf an improper item allowed by a jury, and he declare this to have been his only reason, the court may, on such item being relinquished, vacate the order.
